title: Rotational equilibrium - two forces on rod

content.question: The uniform rod shown in the figure is fixed to a table by a pivot through the center. The rod is free to rotate about its center. The left end of the rod is at position <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and the right end is at <math alttext="x equals L " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>L</mi></math>. A force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted at position <math alttext="x equals three fourths L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mi>L</mi></math> and directed toward the top of the page. At what position would an additional force of magnitude <math alttext="2 F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>F</mi></math> directed toward the top of the page need to be exerted so that the rod is in rotational equilibrium?
